channel.title: Torrent DVD rip's are not containing video information
channel.description:
I have downlaoded 2 Full Length DVD rip's of torrents, and neither of them have played in there correct format. I'm just wondering what you guys use to play the videos? Mine automatically open with Windows Media Player, but with Realtime it only plays music as well. The file type under properties says "Video Clip."
Just wondering if anyone else has experienced these problems, and knows how to fix them, or what video player to use which would help.

item.title: Torrent DVD rip's are not containing video information
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

Download G-Spot (http://www.headbands.com/gspot) to identify the exact audio and video codec used in the movie

Read full topic
item.source: Torrent DVD rip's are not containing video information

item.title: Torrent DVD rip's are not containing video information
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

[quote=“jme_009, post:5, topic:18664”]http://www.free-codecs.com/download/K_Lite_Codec_Pack.htm

Get it, you’ll be able to play just about any video on the net. Tommy from the irc told me to get it, and it worked wonders. because I download like 20 movies a day and they were all requiring different codecs all the time, and this fixed them all. All it does is install all you popular codecs, and then you just play your movie from windows media player.[/quote]
Thanks a lot! I will look into it. Also, thanks to everyone else who put the effort in to help me.

Read full topic
item.source: Torrent DVD rip's are not containing video information

item.title: Torrent DVD rip's are not containing video information
item.dc:creator: @Got_Shine Got_Shine
item.description:
@Got_Shine wrote:

You could VLC player, it plays almost any movie format. http://www.videolan.org/vlc/download-windows.html

item.title: Torrent DVD rip's are not containing video information
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

http://www.free-codecs.com/download/K_Lite_Codec_Pack.htm

Get it, you’ll be able to play just about any video on the net. Tommy from the irc told me to get it, and it worked wonders. because I download like 20 movies a day and they were all requiring different codecs all the time, and this fixed them all. All it does is install all you popular codecs, and then you just play your movie from windows media player.

Read full topic

item.title: Torrent DVD rip's are not containing video information
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

frank_:

you probably dont have the proper codec, chances are its divx

Ahh, I’m no good with this stuff… :o

I searched up divx, are you saying I should use that player? Thanks for all the help!

Read full topic
